ygData.subject: Re: Owlhawk's training
ygData.msgSnippet: Katya seemed happy of the decision. Katya: Good. I will speak with Rodimus about this. If he does not want me to train you, I will challenge him to a more

Katya seemed happy of the decision.

Katya: Good. I will speak with Rodimus about this. If he does not want 
me to train you, I will challenge him to a more serious trial.

She waited for Owlhawk's reaction.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...> wrote:
> Owlhawk:  Allow me a moment to answer that.
> 
> He once again goes inside his mind to speak with Owl.
> 
> Hawk:  What do you think?
> 
> Owl:  Well, it might be refreshing to look at a
> totally different state of mind that this training
> would offer.  Besides they're not asking us to totally
> give up being a Maximal.
> 
> Hawk:  Very well.
> 
> Back in the real world.
> 
> Owlhawk:  Very well.
> 
> --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Ragnar turned to Katya and nodded.
> > 
> > Ragnar: I will go and warn Rodimus of the outcome of
> > this trial.
> > 
> > He walks away, making the ground tremble slightly
> > with every step.
> > 
> > Katya: He sees true in your potential. You are
> > strong. However, being 
> > a Clansman... err... Clansbot in your case, that is
> > more than 
> > techniques. It is a lot of training, and probably a
> > major change of 
> > minds. We Clans value zellbringen, single combat.
> > Even in a melee, we 
> > tend to engage no more than one enemy at the time.
> > Also, honor is 
> > above everything else in every aspect of our life...
> > except maybe 
> > politics, but that is easily answered through
> > combat. Are you willing 
> > to become a Clan Warrior?
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., Kyle Stewart <dewboy30816@y...>
> > wrote:
> > > Owlhawk braced himself and put his hands in front
> > of
> > > him to absorb most of the shock of running into
> > the
> > > wall.  Then he stood up and faced them.
> > > 
> > > Owlhawk:  Verywell, I'm open to new techniques.
> > > 
> > > --- warriorazure <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > The punch threw the female warrior far away. As
> > she
> > > > tried to get up, 
> > > > she could not totally conceal her pain.
> > > > 
> > > > Katya: I applaud you, Owlhawk. You do have the
> > > > Wolf's soul and the 
> > > > Bear's strenght. You have bested me in this
> > contest.
> > > > We will work as 
> > > > part of the Maximals as of now.
> > > > 
> > > > Ragnar's towering form came next to her.
> > > > 
> > > > Ragnar: You are a powerful warrior, Owlhawk, and
> > I
> > > > have been thinking. 
> > > > I believe that you could serve the Maximals even
> > > > better if we steep 
> > > > you in the ways of the Clans. If Katya does not
> > > > agree, I will be your 
> > > > trainer. What say you?
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > >
